text:
I was a geek in the times when geeks
were not cool yet in the 90s.

I started computer science
like all geeks do.

In 2013,
I finally found my entry point
into the Berlin start-up scene.

I'm Boris Diebold,
Chief Technology Officer at HeyJobs.

HeyJobs is building
the leading career platform
for essential talents in Europe.

I'm responsible
for the engineering team

which also comprises data science,
and machine learning.

If you think about data protection,
this is ultimately about your rights
and rights is about freedom.

It's a very important topic which
actually has humanity at its core.
At HeyJobs, we have a talent platform

where the talent can sign up
and find a job

by actually giving them
a clearer overview
of benefits the company has to offer.

This transparency actually helps
our essential talent

to level up
their careers continuously
and live a fulfilling life.
We use AWS manage services by default

so we don't have to take care
of operations or security updates
of key systems ourselves,

but we can actually enjoy
the speed of innovation

and let our engineers focus
on the differentiating features.
The employees, they like AWS a lot.

They like the interfaces,
they like the training.

AWS helps a lot in increasing
our competitive advantage

by helping us to iterate
fast on ideas.

Might it be other prototypes
that we use

and getting early access
also to new services,

but also then,
bringing together very quickly
in a GDPR-compliant way

also all our data sources
integrating them with new services,

trying them out and then if it works,
scaling them up.

What excites me
is the intellectual challenge.

It gives me
a very deep sense of satisfaction

and makes me want to wake up
every morning and go to work again.
